item.title: Mathmatical Foundation for Reinforcement Learning
item.description: 1. Markov Property The Markov Property is a fundamental concept in probability theory that states that the future state of a process depends only on its current state and not on the sequence of events that preceded it. 1.1. Random Process A random process (also known as a stochastic process) is a collection of random variables indexed by time. \[\{X_t, t \in [0, \infty)\}\] Itâ€™s often used to model real-world data that changes unpredictably.
